definition: to bewail one's poverty/to complain about being hard up/to pretend to be poor
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly

sentences.english: She usually poor-mouths when it's her turn to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 轮到她捐钱时，她老是哭穷。

sentences.english: She always pleaded poverty and pared down prices.
sentences.chinese: 她老是哭穷，买东西总要讨价还价。

sentences.english: Don't poor-mouth to me. I have your number.
sentences.chinese: 别跟我哭穷了，我还不知道你的秘闻？

sentences.english: Don't poor-mouth to me, I have your number.
sentences.chinese: 别跟我哭穷了，我知道你的底细。

sentences.english: I have got a problem with the spate of wealthy people now crying poverty.
sentences.chinese: 对于现在很多富人哭穷我感到不解。
